    public class SearchIndexPersistenceImpl
extends com.liferay.portal.service.persistence.impl.BasePersistenceImpl<at.meduni.liferay.portlet.rdconnect.model.SearchIndex>
implements at.meduni.liferay.portlet.rdconnect.service.persistence.SearchIndexPersistence
    The persistence implementation for the search index service.

    Caching information and settings can be found in portal.properties

    Author:
    Robert Reihs
    See Also:
    SearchIndexPersistence, SearchIndexUtil

      • findByExactSearch

        public java.util.List<at.meduni.liferay.portlet.rdconnect.model.SearchIndex> findByExactSearch(java.lang.String value,
                                                                                      int start,
                                                                                      int end)
                                                                                        throws com.liferay.portal.kernel.exception.SystemException
        Returns a range of all the search indexs where value = ?.

        Useful when paginating results. Returns a maximum of end - start instances. start and end are not primary keys, they are indexes in the result set. Thus, 0 refers to the first result in the set. Setting both start and end to QueryUtil.ALL_POS will return the full result set. If orderByComparator is specified, then the query will include the given ORDER BY logic. If orderByComparator is absent and pagination is required (start and end are not QueryUtil.ALL_POS), then the query will include the default ORDER BY logic from SearchIndexModelImpl. If both orderByComparator and pagination are absent, for performance reasons, the query will not have an ORDER BY clause and the returned result set will be sorted on by the primary key in an ascending order.

        Specified by:
        findByExactSearch in interface at.meduni.liferay.portlet.rdconnect.service.persistence.SearchIndexPersistence
        Parameters:
        value - the value
        start - the lower bound of the range of search indexs
        end - the upper bound of the range of search indexs (not inclusive)
        Returns:
        the range of matching search indexs
        Throws:
        com.liferay.portal.kernel.exception.SystemException - if a system exception occurred

      • findByExactSearch

        public java.util.List<at.meduni.liferay.portlet.rdconnect.model.SearchIndex> findByExactSearch(java.lang.String value,
                                                                                      int start,
                                                                                      int end,
                                                                                      com.liferay.portal.kernel.util.OrderByComparator orderByComparator)
                                                                                        throws com.liferay.portal.kernel.exception.SystemException
        Returns an ordered range of all the search indexs where value = ?.

        Useful when paginating results. Returns a maximum of end - start instances. start and end are not primary keys, they are indexes in the result set. Thus, 0 refers to the first result in the set. Setting both start and end to QueryUtil.ALL_POS will return the full result set. If orderByComparator is specified, then the query will include the given ORDER BY logic. If orderByComparator is absent and pagination is required (start and end are not QueryUtil.ALL_POS), then the query will include the default ORDER BY logic from SearchIndexModelImpl. If both orderByComparator and pagination are absent, for performance reasons, the query will not have an ORDER BY clause and the returned result set will be sorted on by the primary key in an ascending order.

        Specified by:
        findByExactSearch in interface at.meduni.liferay.portlet.rdconnect.service.persistence.SearchIndexPersistence
        Parameters:
        value - the value
        start - the lower bound of the range of search indexs
        end - the upper bound of the range of search indexs (not inclusive)
        orderByComparator - the comparator to order the results by (optionally null)
        Returns:
        the ordered range of matching search indexs
        Throws:
        com.liferay.portal.kernel.exception.SystemException - if a system exception occurred

      • clearCache

        public void clearCache()
        Clears the cache for all search indexs.

        The EntityCache and FinderCache are both cleared by this method.

        Specified by:

      • findAll

        public java.util.List<at.meduni.liferay.portlet.rdconnect.model.SearchIndex> findAll(int start,
                                                                            int end)
                                                                              throws com.liferay.portal.kernel.exception.SystemException
        Returns a range of all the search indexs.

        Useful when paginating results. Returns a maximum of end - start instances. start and end are not primary keys, they are indexes in the result set. Thus, 0 refers to the first result in the set. Setting both start and end to QueryUtil.ALL_POS will return the full result set. If orderByComparator is specified, then the query will include the given ORDER BY logic. If orderByComparator is absent and pagination is required (start and end are not QueryUtil.ALL_POS), then the query will include the default ORDER BY logic from SearchIndexModelImpl. If both orderByComparator and pagination are absent, for performance reasons, the query will not have an ORDER BY clause and the returned result set will be sorted on by the primary key in an ascending order.

        Specified by:
        findAll in interface at.meduni.liferay.portlet.rdconnect.service.persistence.SearchIndexPersistence
        Parameters:
        start - the lower bound of the range of search indexs
        end - the upper bound of the range of search indexs (not inclusive)
        Returns:
        the range of search indexs
        Throws:
        com.liferay.portal.kernel.exception.SystemException - if a system exception occurred

      • findAll

        public java.util.List<at.meduni.liferay.portlet.rdconnect.model.SearchIndex> findAll(int start,
                                                                            int end,
                                                                            com.liferay.portal.kernel.util.OrderByComparator orderByComparator)
                                                                              throws com.liferay.portal.kernel.exception.SystemException
        Returns an ordered range of all the search indexs.

        Useful when paginating results. Returns a maximum of end - start instances. start and end are not primary keys, they are indexes in the result set. Thus, 0 refers to the first result in the set. Setting both start and end to QueryUtil.ALL_POS will return the full result set. If orderByComparator is specified, then the query will include the given ORDER BY logic. If orderByComparator is absent and pagination is required (start and end are not QueryUtil.ALL_POS), then the query will include the default ORDER BY logic from SearchIndexModelImpl. If both orderByComparator and pagination are absent, for performance reasons, the query will not have an ORDER BY clause and the returned result set will be sorted on by the primary key in an ascending order.

        Specified by:
        findAll in interface at.meduni.liferay.portlet.rdconnect.service.persistence.SearchIndexPersistence
        Parameters:
        start - the lower bound of the range of search indexs
        end - the upper bound of the range of search indexs (not inclusive)
        orderByComparator - the comparator to order the results by (optionally null)
        Returns:
        the ordered range of search indexs
        Throws:
        com.liferay.portal.kernel.exception.SystemException - if a system exception occurred
